attributes.comment:
To whom it may concern;
I am appalled to find that the US Citizenship and Immigration Services is planning
to increase the fees required by parents in the United States petitioning the
government to adopt a foreign-born child (docket # USCIS-2006-0044). This great
country of ours supports so many other causes for humane efforts, yet it not only
makes it extremely difficult for people in the US to adopt foreign-born children, it
also adds to the financial burden. Currently some of the documents required by
potential parents in the United States expire before the adoption can be
completed, mandating that these fees be paid not once, but twice. Now you are
planning to increase these fees on top of that. It is a complete scandal that you
would even consider such action. Please immediately reverse this docket now
before it is passed and stop adding to the burden of parents who are trying to
make this world a better place by giving a home to a child who would otherwise
have none.
Respectfully,
Marilyn B. Malstrom

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Marilyn Malstrom
